meanings.sent1: The long wait in line can disgruntle customers.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site began to disgruntle the residents.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to play with the new toy disgruntled its owner.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain disgruntled the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The lack of appreciation from his boss continued to disgruntle him.

meanings.definition: To put into a state of sulky dissatisfaction
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather seemed to disgruntle her mood.
meanings.sent2: The child's tantrum disgruntled the other shoppers in the store.
meanings.sent3: His refusal to share the toys disgruntled his playmates.
meanings.sent4: The loss of the game disgruntled the team captain.
meanings.sent5: The delayed flight disgruntled the tired passengers.
